statement:
Oftentimes, one needs to estimate differences of powers of real numbers.
The following inequalities are useful for this purpose:
$$n (u-v) v^{n-1} < u^n - v^n < n (u-v) u^{n-1}$$
$$n x \le (1 + x)^n - 1$$
$$(1 + x)^n - 1 \le { n x \over 1 - (n - 1) x}$$

Here $n$ is an integer greater than 1. The first inequality holds when
$0 < v < u$, the second inequality holds when $-1 < x $, and the third
inequality holds when $-1 < x < 1/(n-1)$. Equality can only occur in the
latter two inequalities when $x = 0$.
